intro: Ormiscus pusillus, commonly known as the dwarf ormiscus, is a small, flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
